content.html:
Indiekit

Paul’s indie web project is live!

Meet the little Node.js server with all the parts needed to publish content to your personal website and share it on social networks.

You can read the accompanying blog post.

content.html:
Imagine a journalist thinking that John Mastodon was a tech entrepreneur!

Everyone knows that John Mastodon was the actor in that movie, Goncharov.

content.html:
Feeling a Mastodon instance cope with the latest influx of people is like being Han Solo in the Millennium Falcon:

“Don’t worry—she’ll hold together! (You hear me, baby, hold together!)”

https://www.patreon.com/mastodon

content.html:
99 Good News Stories From 2022

A look at back at what wasn’t in the headlines this year.
content.value:
99 Good News Stories From 2022



A look at back at what wasn’t in the headlines this year.

photo.alt: Two old-fashioned looking white ships docked in a calm harbour with green water under a clear blue sky.

Looking across the street to the green-coloured Flatiron-like Zoetrope building with the spike of the Transamerica building in the background. In the foreground is a traffic sign that reads Do Not Enter.

content.html: Bye, bye, San Francisco!
content.value: Bye, bye, San Francisco!

photo.alt: Krystal Higgins on stage in a purple outfit in front of blue curtains. Her gestures make it look like she’s in mid song. Meanwhile, Eric Meyer’s head peaks above the lectern table labelled with the An Event Apart logo.

content.html: I’ll admit I was sceptical when An Event Apart pivoted to its new Broadway format, but #AEASF The Musical is great!
content.value: I’ll admit I was sceptical when An Event Apart pivoted to its new Broadway format, but #AEASF The Musical is great!

content.html:
Pluralistic: Web apps could de-monopolize mobile devices (13 Dec 2022) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

But you can’t have a web app without a web-app-compatible browser, and you can’t get a web-app-compatible browser in Apple’s App Store. The only browsers permitted in the App Store are those based on WebKit, the browser engine behind Safari. This means that every browser on iOS, from Firefox to Edge to Chrome, is just a reskinned version of Safari.
content.value:
Pluralistic: Web apps could de-monopolize mobile devices (13 Dec 2022) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow




  But you can’t have a web app without a web-app-compatible browser, and you can’t get a web-app-compatible browser in Apple’s App Store. The only browsers permitted in the App Store are those based on WebKit, the browser engine behind Safari. This means that every browser on iOS, from Firefox to Edge to Chrome, is just a reskinned version of Safari.

name: Pluralistic: Web apps could de-monopolize mobile devices (13 Dec 2022) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

content.html:
Just gave a new talk on declarative design at #AEASF—now I can relax and enjoy the other talks!

Thank you to everyone here for being such an attentive audience and allowing me to rant and rave.

photo.alt: A low winter sun in a clear blue sky illuminates a sandy beach with the silhouettes of people walking by the sea.
An unoccupied lifeguard tower painted with the number five at the edge of a sandy beach under a clear blue sky.
A headland next to a beach with shallow water making a reflective surface under a clear blue sky.
A lifeguard tower in front of some rocks reflected in the shallow water on a sandy beach.

content.html: Greetings from San Diego, California.
